meanings.definition: A curved piece of metal or plastic used to help slide the heel of a shoe into place.
meanings.sent1: My grandma's old shoehorn makes putting on shoes easier.
meanings.sent2: The shoehorn was a handy tool for slipping on tight shoes.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat used the shoehorn as a tiny slide for its toys.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a shoehorn, effortlessly easing people into conversation.
meanings.sent5: The shiny shoehorn gleamed in the sunlight, beckoning to be used.

meanings.definition: To assist or facilitate in a smooth or easy manner.
meanings.sent1: I had to shoehorn my way through the crowded room to reach the exit.
meanings.sent2: The team worked together to shoehorn the heavy box into the small space.
meanings.sent3: He tried to shoehorn too many tasks into his schedule, causing chaos.
meanings.sent4: Her clever idea shoehorned its way into the discussion, capturing everyone's attention.
meanings.sent5: The new technology will shoehorn efficiency into our daily routines.
